description: Fetches the temporarily cached result of an SQL statement in JSON format. The ExecuteStatement or BatchExecuteStatement operation that ran the SQL statement must have specified ResultFormat as JSON , or let the format default to JSON. A token is returned to page through the statement results. For more information about the Amazon Redshift Data API and CLI usage examples, see Using the Amazon Redshift Data API in the Amazon Redshift Management Guide.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the SQL statement whose results are to be fetched. This value is a universally unique identifier (UUID) generated by Amazon Redshift Data API. A suffix indicates then number of the SQL statement. For example, d9b6c0c9-0747-4bf4-b142-e8883122f766:2 has a suffix of :2 that indicates the second SQL statement of a batch query. This identifier is returned by BatchExecuteStatment, ExecuteStatment, and ListStatements.

nested_items.name: ColumnMetadata
nested_items.description: The properties (metadata) of a column.

nested_items.name: columnDefault
nested_items.description: The default value of the column.

nested_items.name: isCaseSensitive
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: isCurrency
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column contains currency values.

nested_items.name: isSigned
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether an integer column is signed.

nested_items.name: label
nested_items.description: The label for the column.

nested_items.name: length
nested_items.description: The length of the column.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the column.

nested_items.name: nullable
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the column is nullable.

nested_items.name: precision
nested_items.description: The precision value of a decimal number column.

nested_items.name: scale
nested_items.description: The scale value of a decimal number column.

nested_items.name: schemaName
nested_items.description: The name of the schema that contains the table that includes the column.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that includes the column.

nested_items.name: typeName
nested_items.description: The database-specific data type of the column.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A value that indicates the starting point for the next set of response records in a subsequent request. If a value is returned in a response, you can retrieve the next set of records by providing this returned NextToken value in the next NextToken parameter and retrying the command. If the NextToken field is empty, all response records have been retrieved for the request.

nested_items.name: Records
nested_items.description: The results of the SQL statement in JSON format.

nested_items.name: blobValue
nested_items.description: (list) ---

nested_items.name: blobValue
nested_items.description: A value of the BLOB data type.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: A value of the Boolean data type.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: A value of the double data type.

nested_items.name: isNull
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether the data is NULL.

nested_items.name: longValue
nested_items.description: A value of the long data type.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: A value of the string data type.

nested_items.name: TotalNumRows
nested_items.description: The total number of rows in the result set returned from a query. You can use this number to estimate the number of calls to the GetStatementResult operation needed to page through the results.
